content.description: Climb the diagonal seam up crimps to a sloper and a V-notch.  Tops out above the Frisco Buttress.
content.location: Park at the trailhead parking just north of I-70 at exit 201.  Walk down the on-ramp until the first light pole, turn right and walk up a fairly obvious trail for about 50 feet.  You can see the boulder (more of a mini-cliff) from the highway.

content.description: This is a warm-up for the area. Traverse on slightly overhung stone on big holds. Begin as far right as you can go, then work left up the big slash.
content.location: The furthest right line, it's the first thing you hit after the short hill ends.

content.description:
Positive holds lead to a bulge, pull, and top out. This is another fun warm-up for the area, nothing too special. It has likely been climbed before, I just gave it a fun name.

Don't beef it or you may tumble onto I-70.
content.location: It is the furthest left you can go before walking off a grassy ledge. Begin on a distinct stone triangle, and go straight up trending left.

content.description:
Climb up some edges and jugs on the right of an orange-ish, crystallized, vertical streak. This is to the right of

Via The Hot One

and just right of a right-leaning crack.
Climb the overhanging arete.  This has amazing moves, amazing rock, and not so amazing proximity to I-70.
content.protection: Pads and, if you can swing one, a spotter.  Also recommended is a pair of headphones to drown out the traffic.
content.location: Park at the trailhead parking just north of I-70 at exit 201. Walk down the on-ramp until the first light pole, turn right and walk up a fairly obvious trail for about 50 feet. You can see the boulder (more of a mini-cliff) from the highway.
